text: Hi, I'm Shah Mameh. I'm a 21 year old with passion for research in AI. I'm applying for
a research engineer role in Google's AI market. But what makes me any different from thousands
of applicants? Every two minutes of your time and in a long, long sense. I graduated from
the Indian Institute of Science with a degree in mathematics, expertise in seed and Python
and also with frameworks like TensorFlow and ROS. I co-founded the innovation cell by University
where we worked on some really cool projects. In name of you, I worked on a project called
TTE where we built a system for the detection, prevention, choking, and tracheostomation.
I also worked on a project called BarrowX which was a military project where we used
a laser-based remote pressure sensor for the detection of stress fighters. I have also
been an active part of the AI alignment community for my first semester. I'm very interested
in mechanistic interpretability of large language models from AI safety and capability understanding
perspective. I am an active participant in key to competitions. I've also got some experience
computer vision due to working on autonomous driving systems. But enough of the boring
stuff. You might be wondering what else I'm going to do. Apart from cute cat videos and
singing when I'm alone, I'm also interested in swimming, chess, working out, and martial arts.
So why should I? I have a very relevant technical experience and a very interdisciplinary
education background that involves courses in mathematics, physics, biology, and career
science which allows me to bring innovative solutions to the toughest problems. I'm also
a communicator and I've been involved in very interesting things over the last few years.
I look forward to using my skills and passion to bring a real and positive impact to the
organization and to more in the future of the world. That is all. If you want to get in
touch, drop me an email or download my CV. Thank you.
